title: Ellie's Big Dream: Dancing on TV
summary: Ellie Goldstein is a 24-year-old woman with Down's syndrome who loves to dance. She dreamed of being on a TV show called Strictly Come Dancing, where people dance every week. Her mom, Yvonne, always believed Ellie could do anything, even when others said she might not walk or talk. Ellie worked hard and became a model for magazines like Vogue and acted in a TV series. When she got the call to join Strictly, she was very happy and screamed with joy. Now, she dances on the show with her partner Vito, proving that people with disabilities can achieve big dreams. Ellie's story helps change how people see those with learning disabilities, showing that everyone can shine.

background_read: Ellie Goldstein is a young woman with Down's syndrome, which is a condition that can affect how people learn and move. She lives in Essex with her mom, Yvonne, who always encouraged her to follow her dreams. Ellie loves dancing and wanted to be on Strictly Come Dancing, a fun TV show where celebrities learn to dance. She also worked as a model for big brands and acted in a TV series. Her story shows that with support and hard work, people with disabilities can do amazing things and inspire others.
